name: spec-command
description: spec command file support for VS Code

spec-command.showReferenceManualInPrevie.markdownDescription: Shows a preview (Webview created by built-in Markdown extension) in addition to a markdown source after [Open Reference Manual](command:spec-command.openReferenceManual) command is invoked.

spec-command.editor.hintVolume.hover.description: Controls the volume of explanatory text in hovers, which is shown when the mouse cursor is on a symbol.

spec-command.editor.hintVolume.completio.description: Controls the volume of explanatory text in auto completion, which is shown when the user types a symbol.

spec-command.editor.hintVolume.signature.description: Controls the volume of explanatory text in signature help, which is shown when the user edits function arguments.

spec-command.editor.codeSnippets.markdownDescription: Lists code snippet templates that may include a placeholder of motor (`%MOT`) or counter (`%CNT`) mnemonics in TextMate snippet syntax. Read [Snippets in Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets) for other information about the syntax. Example: `mv ${1%MOT} ${2:pos} # absolute move`.

spec-command.suggest.suppressMessages.markdownDescription: Suppresses messages shown in code completion.

completionItem.label.detail.description: Hides the detail of unresolved completion item labels, where parameters of functions are typically shown.

completionItem.label.description.description: Hides the description of unresolved completion item labels, where file paths are typically shown.

completionItem.documentation.description: Truncates explanatory text of a selected item of auto completion suggestions to a sentence.

signatureHelp.signatures.documentation.description: Truncates explanatory text in a signature help, which is shown when the user edits function arguments, to a paragraph.

hover.contents.description: Truncates explanatory text in a hover, which is shown when the mouse cursor is on a symbol, to a paragraph.

spec-command.mnemonic.motors.markdownDescription: Lists motor mnemonics, which will be used by IntelliSense and code snippets. One can optionally add the description after `#` letter. Example: `tth # Detector's two-theta angle`.

spec-command.mnemonic.counters.markdownDescription: Lists counter mnemonics, which will be used by IntelliSense and code snippets. One can optionally add the descriptions after `#` letter. Example: `sec # count time in second`.

spec-command.suggest.codeSnippets.markdownDescription:
Lists key-value pairs of code snippets for IntelliSense code suggestion. The key is a snippet name on which IntelliSense substring matching is performed and the value is a snippet template to be inserted into the editor. The template may contain special placeholders for motors (`%MOT`) and counters (`%CNT`), in addition to built-in tabstops, placeholders, choise and variables described in [Snippets in Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_snippet-syntax). Descriptive text can follow after a hash sign (`#`). Example: 

```json
{ "mv2": "mv ${1%MOT1} ${2:pos1} ${3%MOT2} ${4:pos2} # 2-motor move" }
```

spec-command.suggest.motors.markdownDescription: Lists key-value (mnemonic-explanatory text) pairs of motors for IntelliSense code suggestion.

spec-command.suggest.counters.markdownDescription: Lists key-value (mnemonic-explanatory text) pairs of counters for IntelliSense code suggestion.

spec-command.workspace.inclusiveFilePatt.markdownDescription: Specifies a glob pattern used to find files in a workspace. Symbols in pattern-matched files becomes available in code navigation. See [VS Code API](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#GlobPattern) for the syntax.
spec-command.workspace.inclusiveFilePatt.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please use the built-in `#files.associations#` property, instead.

spec-command.workspace.exclusiveFilePatt.markdownDescription: Specifies a glob pattern used to exclude files in a workspace from being parsed. See [VS Code API](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#GlobPattern) for the syntax.
spec-command.workspace.exclusiveFilePatt.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please use the built-in `#files.exclude#` property, instead.

spec-command.workspace.diagnoseProblems.description: Controls whether diagnostic results of files in a workspace are listed in 'Problems' view. If disabled, only syntax problems of files opened by editors are listed.

spec-command.terminal.filePathPrefix.markdownDescription: Specifies a file path prefix used in [Run File in Active Terminal](command:spec-command.execFileInTerminal) command. This option is useful for case in which the working directory of __spec__ running in a terminal view is different from the workspace folder.

spec-command.command.filePathPrefixInTer.markdownDescription: Specifies a file path prefix used in [Run File in Active Terminal](command:spec-command.execFileInTerminal) command. This option is useful for case in which the working directory of __spec__ running in a terminal view is different from the workspace folder.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: The "spec-command.terminal.filePathPrefix" configuration property is disabled in untrusted workspaces in order to protect from code injection when the "Run File in Active Terminal" command is called.

scripts.pretest-node: pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint
